file_content.text: Lot easier for Organa to fight without worrying about those CryoBan weapons. Thanks again.
CryoBan weapons. Those Thul soldiers are empty-handed now.
Dead, too, from what I hear. Good work. Not like they were going to hand them over by asking nicely.
I'll make sure Organa knows what you did. And these'll go in the first trash compactor I find.
Better get moving. House Thul keeps those CryoBan weapons, and we'll all end up icicles.
First squad I've seen around here not fighting for their lives. Got a minute?
Wait. There's no kind of tech that could take a Jedi down. Could use your help.
Lieutenant. Glad to see one officer not limping back from the field. Need help.
Hey there, Captain. How'd you like to stiff one of your own for a good cause?
Name's Aza. Or Private Gundo, if you prefer. On guard for House Organa with the rest of the Republic.
Got word House Thul is smuggling in CryoBan weapons. Very illegal. Freeze you in three seconds flat.
Don't count on House Thul for a fair fight.
Typical of them.
House Organa could do with a little less fairness. But they want a clean battlefield.
I hope no one discovered this the hard way.
That sounds painful.
First few died from shock. Rest are still waiting to get the feeling back in their toes.
I haven't seen this technology on the battlefield.
This is news to me.
A Thul victory's still not a sure thing. Probably saving it for the big offensive.
Sometimes fighting dirty's the only way to win.
I like their style.
Not to House Organa. They want a clean, honest battlefield. Good luck with that.
"Got word" from who?
Used to run with a bad crowd. But I'm trying to go legit, with the Republic, you follow?
So tell House Organa.
Little busy with the war and all. Few men the Republic can spare don't even get close.
We squashed the smuggling ring a few days ago. But House Thul's got plenty of CryoBan weapons already.
We don't destroy what's left, they'll keep moving in on Organa territory, one frozen guard at a time.
I want to help, if I can.
These weapons could give House Organa the edge.
Why destroy them?
Too unstable. Any shot could backfire, take out the whole squad. Thul will risk that. We won't.
I don't want to be frozen.
I sympathize, but if we don't handle this now, it's only going to get worse.
Lot of the frozen come back from the Vinerium. Best lead we have on where to find the CryoBan weapons.
The Vinerium?
Royal farmland for the royal wine. Valuable. Good place to hide.
You're lucky I'm here.
Long as you don't come back in a block of ice, I'll be impressed.
Bring me those CryoBan weapons quick. Thul doesn't need another edge.
Too busy. [Refuse quest]
Fine Republic you are. Makes a man wonder which side you're on.
I can't talk to you now. I'm here on official Republic business.
